INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section Rule 126. The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative rules
and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the continual
needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Allegation On 1/27/23, youth was observed with bruises up and down their arms
and bags under their eyes. On the evening of 1/27/23, youth was
restrained and there is a concern for their wellbeing. Youth has
complained of chest pains in the past after being restrained.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on January 31, 2023
and reported Youth A told her he was playing and ran into the
wall. Complainant stated this was the first time ever seeing a bruise on
Youth A since being at the facility. Complainant stated she thinks
Youth A looks tired and is worried about the level of care he is receiving
at the facility.
Youth A was interviewed face to face, twice at the facility on
January 30, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A
stated he got the bruise on his right arm from running into a wall in the
gym when he was playing kickball. Youth A reported he “jumped up
2

and couldn’t stop myself and hit the wall.” Youth A stated he could not
recall what day he ran into the wall. Youth A reported Staff 1, Staff 2
and Nurse looked at his arm. Youth A denied having any other bruises.
There were no other bruises visible on Youth A’s arms. Youth A did not
appear to have bags under his eyes. Youth A reported being in a
restraint recently with Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2. Youth A stated
he did not recall the placement of Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2’s
hands while being restrained. Youth A denied being hurt during the
restraint or any previous restraint. Youth A denied ever having
problems breathing during a restraint, receiving bruises or scratches or
staff using too much force. Youth A stated he feels safe at the facility
and does not have any staff he does not like.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 30, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor 1
described restraining Youth A with assistance from Supervisor 2.
Supervisor 1 stated Supervisor 2 held Youth A’s arms and Supervisor 1
held Youth A’s legs. Supervisor 1 denied seeing a bruise on Youth A's
lower arm but did notice a small bruise on Youth A’s upper arm.
Supervisor 1 stated Youth A reported that bruise was from another
youth. Supervisor 1 denied Youth A complaining of chest pains during
the restraint. Supervisor 1 denied having concerns with Youth A’s
wellbeing at the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 30,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 denied seeing
Youth A run into the wall during gym or being told by Youth A that he
ran into the wall. Staff 1 stated he has never heard Youth A complain
of chest pains while in a restraint or after a restraint. Staff 1 denied
having any concerns with Youth A’s wellbeing.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 30, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor 2
reported Youth A frequently runs into the wall during gym. Supervisor 2
stated Youth A slides, dives, and runs hard while playing any game
during gym. Supervisor 2 stated he was in a restraint with Youth A
where he held Youth A’s arms and Supervisor 1 bridged Youth A’s legs
on January 27, 2023. Supervisor 2 stated Youth A showed him a
bruise on Youth A’s forearm the same day but did not say what caused
the bruise. Supervisor 2 stated the bruise on Youth A’s forearm is not
where someone would place their hands during a restraint. Supervisor
2 denied Youth A complained of chest pains during the restraint.
Supervisor 2 stated he does not recall Youth A ever complaining of
chest pains during a restraint or after a restraint. Supervisor stated he
does not have any concerns with Youth A’s wellbeing at the facility.
4

Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 30,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Nurse stated he
examined Youth A on January 30, 2023. Nurse reported Youth A had
an impact bruise on right posterior forearm. Nurse stated he believes
the bruise was an impact bruise because it was a linear bruise. Nurse
reported Youth A said the bruise was caused by running into the gym
wall while playing kickball. Nurse denied Youth A ever complaining of
chest pains. Nurse stated he does not have any concerns with Youth
A's wellbeing at the facility.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 30,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B stated he saw
the bruise on Youth A’s arm and reported it was “self-inflicted.” Youth B
described Youth A as “clumsy” and said, “what time does Youth A does
not get hurt when playing kickball.”
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on February 1, 2023, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility. Staff 2
stated he was aware of the bruise on Youth A’s forearm and that it was
from running into the wall during gym. Staff 2 stated he gave Youth A
ice and Tylenol after the incident. Staff 2 reported Youth A frequently
runs into the wall during gym from playing hard and going after the ball.
Staff 2 stated Youth A plays hard, he runs, falls, slides, and dives. Staff
2 denied ever hearing Youth A complain of chest pain during a restraint
or after a restraint. Staff 2 stated he does not have any concerns with
Youth A’s wellbeing and feels Youth A is doing well at the facility.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on February 1, 2023, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility. Staff 3
reported Youth A plays hard while in gym and will frequently run into
the wall with his arms bent hitting his forearms into the wall. Staff 3
stated he has given Youth A ice before when that happens. Staff 3
reported he saw the bruise on Youth A’s forearm and heard it was from
running into the wall during gym. Staff 3 denied hearing Youth A
complain of chest pains during a restraint or after a restraint. Staff 3
stated he does not have any concerns with Youth A’s wellbeing and
feels the facility is doing all it can for Youth A.
Therapist was interviewed via telephone February 1, 2023, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Therapist reported Youth A told
her the bruise on his arm was from playing at the gym. Therapist
denied Youth A reporting chest pains from being in restraints.
Therapist stated she does not have any concerns with Youth A’s
placement or wellbeing. Therapist reported Youth A is making progress
in his programing. Therapist stated she has not noticed dark circles
under Youth A’s eyes.
4

DHHS Worker had no findings in the investigation.
Documents Reviewed
• Hainley House Residential Schedule from 01/23/23 –
01/29/2023: Gym was scheduled on 01/25/23, 01/26/2023,
01/27/2023, 01/28/2023 and 01/29/2023.
• Incident Reports for Youth A: Youth A has been in seven
restraints while placed at Eagle Village. No report of chest pain
by Youth A documented in any restraint. No bruises or
scratches on Youth A documented in any of the restraint reports.
• Eagle Village Health Care Visit Report for Youth A dated
01/30/2023: Right posterior forearm linear bruise running
vertically located centrally. Youth A denied any other injuries or
pain, stated bruise from playing kickball.
Analysis Based upon interviews there is no evidence that supports Youth A
having chest pains when restrained or concerns with his wellbeing.
Interviews with Complainant, Youth A and Staff 2 confirm the bruise on
Youth A’s forearm was caused from Youth A running into the wall in the
gym.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
